    • Constructor Detail

      • WelchAverage

        public WelchAverage(double[][] runsOutput,
                    int[] windowSizes)
        This class applies Welch's moving average method to output collected during a number of simulation runs. Typically between 5 and 10 simulation runs are used, and for each simulation run the values of output variables of interest are collected for a number of time intervals ((see Section 7.3.1 of "Modelling and Simulation: Exploring System Dynamics, Louis G. Birta, Gilbert Arbez, 2nd Edition, Springer, 2013). Welch's method consists of the following steps:
        1. For each time interval, average the values over all simulation runs, giving avg_a_i (i from 0 to NUM_INTERVALS). Thus all simulation runs are combined to give a single sequence of average values for each interval over the observation interval.
        2. A second averaging process is applied to the above sequence. For each time interval, a new average is calculated using adjacent values (the number is determined by the window size). This step is repeated for each window size provided in the windowSizes parameter. A window size of 0 is a valid value - in this case the application of the moving average method does not change the values avg_a_i.
        The constructor simply makes duplicate copies of the arrays referenced by the parameters and applies Welchs moving average method to create a new set of output values over the observation interval for each window size provided. Thus immutable objects are created from this class. Getters are provided to access the new output generated by applying the moving average method. to access
        Parameters:
        runsOutput - This parameter should reference a 2D double array with NUM_RUN rows and NUM_INTERVALS columns where NUM_RUN is the number of runs used to collect the output values, and NUM_INTERVAL gives the number of time intervals used to collect output values for each of the runs.
        windowSizes - This parameter gives an array of window sizes used in Welch's method

    • Method Detail

      • getAvgSimRunOutput

        public double[] getAvgSimRunOutput()
        This method returns a reference to a double array that contains the average of each interval over all simulation runs. Thus the length of the array will be NUM_INTERVALS which corresponds to the number of columns of the matrix referenced by the simRunsOuput parameter of the class Constructor.
        Returns:
        Reference to an array that contains the average of the output over all simulation runs.

      • getWelchAvgOutput

        public double[][] getWelchAvgOutput()
        This method returns a reference to a matrix in which each row contains the values created by applying Welch's moving average method to the avgSimRunsOuput array using the window sizes provided by the array referenced by the Constructor parameter windowSizes. Each row is created in the matrix with the corresponding (i.e. at the same index) value in the windowSizes array.

        Note that the number of values generated with Welch's method depends on the value of the window size; the number of values is reduce by the window size itself (e.g. if the window size is 5, there will be 5 less values created than for a window size of 0). This implies that each row in the matrix will have different lengths and thus care must be taken not to go beyond the end of a row.

        The following illustrates the format of the matrix and how it corresponds to the array windosSizes. windowSizes Welch Average Matrix Index Value Row Index Row Content Length of Row 0 w0 0 Values generated with window size = w0 runsOutput.length - w0 1 w1 0 Values generated with window size = w1 runsOutput.length - w1 2 w2 0 Values generated with window size = w2 runsOutput.length - w2 .... n wn 0 Values generated with window size = wn runsOutput.length - wn

        Returns:
        A reference to a Welch Average matrix as described above.
